passages.text:
You walk in the door to an old tavern. In front of you there's a bar top.  To your left some old pictures.  To your right a pool table.

Go Straight
Go Left
Go Right
passages.name: Ye Ole Tavern

passages.text:
You approach the bar top, and the bartender comes out of a backroom.
Would you like a drink?

Ask for a Drink
Go Left
Go Right
Go Back
passages.name: Bar Top

passages.text:
You find a couple of old pictures:
The first is dated 1915 and appears to be when the tavern's original owners.
The second is dated 1948 and is a group of eight soldiers.

Ask About The First
Ask About The Second
Go Right
Go Back
passages.name: Old Pictures

passages.text:
There's a pool table that appears to have been left in the middle of a game.  However, it's only you and the bartender in the tavern. There's a small hole in the wall and jukebox in the corner.

Go to the Jukebox
Examine the Hole
Go Left
Go Back
passages.name: Pool Table

passages.text:
The bartender tells you that the tavern was first opened in 1915 by two brothers.  He tells you about a little of the history.  He says that the tavern was very popular with the Italian-American mob in the late 80's.

Go Back
passages.name: First Picture

passages.text:
The bartender tells you that the two men in the middle of the picture were actually the sons of the original owners. They were fighting in World War II. 

Go Back
passages.name: Second Picture

passages.text:
You get a drink.

Go Back
passages.name: Drink

passages.text:
There's a jukebox, but it doesn't appear to be working.

Go Back
passages.name: Jukebox

passages.text:
There's a small hole the size of a bullet.  Maybe something happened when the mob was still here?

Go Back
passages.name: Hole
